lexUnit.name: creep.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move forward on the hands and knees or by dragging the body close to the ground.

sentence.text: I dressed and crept along the endless corridors until I found the staircase and slid silently down the banisters under the disapproving eye of Sir Mauger Grindlewood .
She would pretend to be frightened when he jumped out , would call out to him to be careful when he crept along an overhanging branch and hung , skimming the water .
He crept along the wall , keeping in the shadows .
It was very easy to imagine eyes peering from the gloom , or strange beings creeping along the path behind them .
Piper O'Rourke used her hand to shield the beam of her torch as she crept along the darkened corridors of Belial Base towards the main airlock .
Slowly , step by step , she crept along the terrace until she stood there , looking in .
Then they both creep along the pavement , onto the concrete path , up the concrete stairs to the waiting concrete flat .
As they crept along they could not help wondering what they would find .
Staying close to the wooden wall , he crept along between the shed and the hedge .
No sound came from the garden , so she crept along to the gate and squeezed herself under .
He crept around in the huge inner yard , looking for clues .
Creeping around from hangar to hangar and dodging patrolling sentries they successfully ensured the destruction of several more aircraft , brand-new crated engines and machinery .
Bugs creep around him through the tendrils and quite near a thrush is singing .
On feet that tried desperately to be silent , Belinda crept away , not stopping or turning round until she reached the looming mass of the house .
He settled back and looked up at the ceiling as if he had forgotten she was there , and Maggie had the urge to creep away .
So that most times she wakes first and creeps back and forth in the dark .
Mama made me go to school , but I crept back home just before noon .
I crept back upstairs to my little room and spoke my account of the previous day 's events into my journal .
She crept back to bed and lay next to her husband , taking care to leave a space between their bodies .
He crept back into the kitchen and made himself another cup of tea .
Finally , grabbing the bedcover and wrapping it round herself , she crept back to the head of the stairs .
He crept inconspicuously back to the dashboard , switched on the ignition , and looked at the gauge .
Inside her head , Gilly packed the brown suitcase and crept down the stairs .
She crept down , keeping her suitcase under her right arm to conceal it as best she could with her body .
She crept quietly down to find out what was happening and heard her 5-year-old girl tell her 3-year-old brother to open the fridge and get out some chocolate .
Blair crept down to the bank whilst I rehearsed various reasons to explain why he had not caught the trout : lack of experience , bad casting technique .
Then she opened the bedroom door and crept down through the dark , silent house .
I crept off down a little path through curling bracken .
I said I believed them to be following the correct route and then crept off into the mist surreptitiously to whip out my compass .
She turned her back on the squabbling creatures and crept off along the footpath .
Had the Pages ' passion been for Lalique glass , the family might have felt constrained to creep about gingerly on tiptoe .
When all was silent , except for the distant buzz of conversation from the tea , she crept out and almost ran down the back passage , as fast as her high-heeled shoes would permit .
He closed the shutters and , leaving the breakfast tray behind , crept out as though she might already be asleep .
When he judged he had gone far enough he crept cautiously out to where the trees were more sparse .
Sheepishly , Gloria crept out from behind me .
He crept over to the door and edged it open .
Examine a scene from the play where one boy creeps up on another and then springs on him stabbing him in the back with his knife .
Cecil crept up behind Sam and poked him with his over-sized weapon .
Mayne and his group crept away , leaving the guards to fight it out between themselves .
He leaped to his feet as the kitchen door suddenly opened , then crept backwards until he was concealed in the darker shadows beyond the turn of the banister .
As the afternoon drew to a close , Mildred crept downstairs and out into the darkening yard .
The monstrous tiger on which Asmodeus sat crept forwards , sulphurous plumes of smoke rising from its nostrils .
When they landed Paul crept forward to peer out into the grassland from behind a tree .
He got up from his mattress , crept across the floor , and looked out .
Slipping off the bed she crept across her room , opening the door as silently as possible .
She crept softly across the room to the piano and touched the keys , although without applying any pressure .
The three of them began to creep slowly down the hill , moving from tree to tree , but no more than a few yards at a time .
Sara crept carefully down the stairs .
Marguerite was sleeping and Jenna crept downstairs in the silent house and made her way to the kitchen to fix herself a milky drink .
At 1.15am , as they slept , Hobbins allegedly crept into the guardroom and took the rifle .
In a flash , Creed was out of the jeep and creeping past foliage and tree-trunks towards the beginning of the picket fence .
The cat was creeping stealthily through a patch of long grass towards the foot of the largest tree .
She crept upstairs to the bathroom , switching off lights as she went .
Gathering up her courage , the little hedgehog crept to the dish .
Maud crept to the door and opened it very slowly .
Blowing out the candle , Tilly crept to the kitchen door and gingerly opened it .
Matilda took the knife she had been eating with , and all four of them crept towards the dining-room door , the father keeping well behind the others .
Then I saw a barrel glinting and realized two soldiers were creeping towards me .
